page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: In Ludworth in the past,the village looked different to now.The village was smaller than it is now. Ludworth Tower was used as a Peel Tower.The east and west walls of Ludworth Tower collaspsed in 1890.All that is left is a window and some remains of a fireplace.North of the Tower under ground there is a tunnel vaulted floor and above it there is a three storeyed wall.If you dug around Ludworth Tower you would probably find some antiquities under ground.There is a sign outside Ludworth Tower telling you all the things that happened to it. The Tower was built in about 1422.Ludworth Tower is presently in the care of the district council, it is not a popular ancient monument and receives few visitors.
